49. Renovation of Brown's Hotel Beach House, Saar Zafrir (2017) Trogir
----------------------------------------------------
A boutique hotel with a winning swimming pool. Designed by hotel architects Saar Zafrir, the continuation of the tiles from the lining of the pool to the deck works seamlessly. The design uses contrasting white (Biancona) and black (Nero Marquina) marble tiles. ---------------------------------------------------- #illustratedspaces #brownshotel #beachclub #rainbowsprinkles #installation #love #taste #colour #girly #icecream #eatme #love #daydream #dreamy #la #museumoficecream #design #graphicdesign #artilike #art #artdaily  #artporn #installation #installationilike

I have a pretty regimented system when it comes to hanging doors
First thing is to laser the head jambs. Even if it's a single door that doesn't need to line up with anything else, I'll always laser the top. This will give you your measurements to ensure a level head jamb. Once that's established you're halfway to a perfectly hung door. 
I usually aim for about a half inch gap under the doors, but that generally depends on the level of the room. Any more of a gap is unsightly and any less you run the risk of rubbing on un level floors or creating a vacuum. 
After I've established jamb leg heights I leave everything assembled from the factory and make my cuts this way. 
After making my cuts I remove the door and stops from the frame and set the frames in their respective holes, wedging the top with shims. I like to do all of my cutting and placing of an entire house before I start the hanging process. 
I find it more productive to stay on a single task rather than switching back and forth between prepping and hanging. 
After the hinge side is set using the same fastener placement every time, I'll pop the door back in the frame and set my strike side reveals. 
Keeping the same system, time after time, especially if it's a good one, dramatically speeds up efficiency. 
What's your method? 
#finishcarpentry #finishcarpenter #trimcarpentry #trimcarpenter #construction #doors #installation #woodwork #festool #finehomebuilding #renovation #design #woodworking
